title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 version of the application uses the Class.forName() method.
EB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 version of the application should have a private constructor. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, it is unnecessary to allow instantiation of the class. By adding a private constructor, we can prevent people from using it. This change does not increase the size of the class, as the compiler automatically provides a public constructor.
SR: To fix this issue, change the line above to: static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); Although not tested, this change is expected to achieve the same functionality.
